intro: Bertolonia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf bertolonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance.
